result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Keith Kubiak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any sentence; release for work and inmate work assignments only; credit for 4 days (01-15-2015 to 01-18-2015).

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Fine set at ZERO.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.

Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month. 
Defendant must attend at least 1 Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment or sobriety support group per week. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
With release for work only.
 This is stayed to use as follows: 
* First violation of positive drug or alcohol test to serve 10 days. 
* Second violation of positive drug or alcohol test to serve 20 days. 
* Third violation of positive drug or alcohol test to serve 30 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle Keith Kubiak

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 - Court ordered defendant to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for work and inmate work assignments only; credit for 4 days( 01-15-2015 to 01-18-2015). 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS with the following conditions:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month. 
- Defendant must attend at least 1 Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment or sobriety support group per week. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Maintain full time work. 
- Court ordered defendants driving privileges suspended for a period of 6 months.
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court ordered defendant to serve 60 DAYS condition time in the House of Correction with release for work only.
 This is stayed to use as follows: 
* First violation of positive drug or alcohol test to serve 10 days. 
* Second violation of positive drug or alcohol test to serve 20 days. 
* Third violation of positive drug or alcohol test to serve 30 days.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 


Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

AS TO COUNT 1 AMENDED  - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Defendant Kyle Keith Kubiak in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.   Marissa Luz Santiago on behalf of David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
BRANCH 17 FOR BRANCH 15 :

AS TO COUNT 1: On state's motion, Court ordered charge amended to Possession of THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 961.41 (3g)(e) , a Misdemeanor.
Case spun to branch 17, Judge Stark. Files sent to court.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.
Sentencing documents received and filed. sab

Defendant Kyle Keith Kubiak in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas. Nick Cerwin for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense counsel hasn't received a response from ADA Santiago as of yet. Case rescheduled for PLEA and SENTENCING on 6/3/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Kyle Keith Kubiak in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Parties need to finalize negotiations. Case rescheduled for PLEA and SENTENCING on 5/26/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Justice Point Reoprt received and filed. sab

Telephone call received from Attorney Leah Thomas.  This matter currently scheduled for a Plea and Sentencing on 4-8-15.  Attorney Thomas will be involved in a Jury Trial in Br. 37 starting at 1:00 p.m.  Matter rescheduled for a Plea and Sentencing.  Defendant to appear on 4-8-15 to obtain new date slip.

Defendant Kyle Keith Kubiak in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant has been diagnosed with anxiety issues. Court orders that the defendant can be drug tested by oral swab rather than urine sample. Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 4/8/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Kyle Keith Kubiak in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Ronald Dague for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 1/26/15.
css

Defendant Kyle Keith Kubiak in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas via telephone.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Br. 17 for Br. 15.
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE. Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time. Case remains calendared for Preliminary Hearing on 1-27-2015 at 8:30 a.m.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Kyle Keith Kubiak in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Kyle Keith Kubiak in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
